_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



The owners, management, and employees are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of ammonia. The policy is to adhere to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations in order to: 1) prevent unnecessary human exposure, 2) reduce the threat to employees' health, and 3) reduce the threat to nearby members of the community.



Safety depends upon the safety devices inherent in the design of the operation, the safe handling procedures used, the training of personnel, and the manner in which an accidental release is handled.



REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The facility is a meat processing plant, blending, grinding, and portioning meat products. There is one regulated process at the facility; the use of anhydrous ammonia for refrigeration. There are three anhydrous ammonia systems at the facility with a total of approximately 65,678 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



The facility complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management and EPA's Accidental Release Rule and all applicable State codes and regulations.



Operators of the anhydrous ammonia system have been trained by the Refrigeration Engineers and Technicians Association (RETA) and attend monthly RETA sessions. Properly trained facility personnel conduct daily inspections and maintenance activities on the ammonia systems. The facility has ammonia detectors in place for early detection of a release or leak.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidental releases of ammonia at the facility in the past five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN



The facility implements an Emergency Action Plan in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.38. Employees receive training on an annual basis. The facility will notify the fire department in the event of an emergency.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The facility believes that safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Improvements to
the program will be made as the opportunity arises.
